div.p: JAY ROBOTIX LEARNING INDIA PVT. LTD. (Jay Robotix) is a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, committed to providing technology-led solutions for augmenting learning abilities and expanding the realms of knowledge in students from Pre-schools, Schools, Higher Education Institutions, and vocational courses, thereby preparing and developing future technocrats and entrepreneurs in India and other countries. Hereinafter referred to as the "First Party".

The above parties enter into a agreement to implement advanced, continuous, and comprehensive Robotics, STEM, and IoT solutions offerings to provide a world-class STEM education experience to the students of . This Agreement will be on a Build, Own, Operate, Transfer (BOOT) basis. The First Party will act as the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and Service Provider, and the Second Party will act as the School Partner.

div.h4: NOW THEREFORE THIS MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING AGREEMENT WITNESSED AS UNDER:
div.p: Whereas, the First Party works in the area of STEM solutions for schools and has proposed the offerings to the Second Party.

Whereas, the Second Party has understood the necessity of such education and is willing to provide all required support to the First Party to design an effective working model under the terms structured in this Agreement.
Now Therefore, First Party and Second Party hereby agree as follows:

ol.li: Robotics-based STEM Education will be offered by the First Party to the selected schools of the Second Party.
First Party sets up and upgrades annually the required Robotics/STEM education setup for the first 5 years & also provides trainer(s) and support for the functioning of the lab.
Second Party would provide enough support to the First Party for setting up the timetables and calendar plans.
Second Party should also provide access to the Computer Lab with an adjusted timetable for the First Party to conduct the Robotics classes in the school.

First Party will set up the Robotics Lab Equipment/STEM education Equipment within 4 weeks of the signed & attested copy of this document, as per the need based on the number of students/computers available.
First Party will be completely responsible for all kinds of technical issues regarding the functioning of the lab equipment provided by the First Party.
First Party will submit a year plan of classes, events, and quizzes to the Second Party.
First Party will submit a detailed Quarterly Report to the Second Party on the activities and performance of the initiative.
First Party will be open to the feedback on a quarterly basis from the Second Party and will do its best to incorporate them as required, if possible.

First Party, after one year of operations, will enhance the lab with advanced sets of equipment and continue the operations for the second year. This process will be repeated for the first five years.
First Party will provide inspirational designs and wallpapers that can serve as enormous promotional activity for the schools.
First Party & Second Party will exchange the branding guidelines and follow them diligently, with approvals on email from time to time, if required.
First Party will also design a Social Media & PR Campaign for Robotics classes within the framework of the Branding guidelines.
First Party will give soft copies of Workbook class-wise for each student.
First Party will handle this program for students in each school.

This Agreement is between the parties, wherein the First Party sets up and upgrades annually the required Robotics/STEM education setup for the first 5 years & also provides dedicated trainer(s) and support for the functioning of the lab.

Second Party should also provide enough support to the First Party’s dedicated trainers for setting up the timetables and calendar plans. Second Party should provide typically two periods in a week for Robotics classes.

First Party will set up the Robotics Lab Equipment/STEM education Equipment and IoT-related offerings within 4 weeks/or agreed date (Oct 01st in Year 1 & April 01st every year from Year 2) of P.O submission by the school as per the need based on the number of students/computers available.
First Party will provide e-learning/RoboGuru portal to all students in the school.

Second Party shall propose and conduct robotics events, marketing exercises, etc., in the school, post consultation & approval from the First Party and subject to a revenue-sharing equation (if any) to be decided at that given point.
First Party will decorate the lab with inspirational designs and wallpapers, which can serve as an enormous promotional activity for the schools.
First Party is responsible to set up adequate trainers at the school as per the need.
First Party is responsible for the technical issues, support, and AMC of the lab.
If Second Party has any issues regarding the lab, Second Party can send a notice email to support@robox.in, detailing out the issue.
Second Party should identify a Point of Contact (POC) from the School side for assisting the trainers from the First Party.
The trainers from the First Party will be of expert level and Certified STEM Trainers.
Trainer from the First Party will be the in charge of the lab at the school, reporting to the School Principal or specified authorities. The Trainer will have access to the equipment in the school.
First Party will constantly train and educate the trainers on the latest technologies and ensure they stay updated with market trends and futuristic needs.

Neither First Party nor Second Party should be held responsible by the other party for issues that arise because of situational handling or individual behavior at the workplace. However, both parties should ensure to take corrective measures as required or applicable as per law in the best spirit of this Agreement to ensure the initiative moves in a positive direction.
Neither Party should recruit the employees of the other party, either directly or indirectly, for at least 6 months from the resignation date from their original parent organization.
Neither Party should encourage discussions of confidential information or internal matters related to the parent organizations at the workplace.
A School Relationship Manager will be assigned to the School.
For any administrative or sales-related discussions, the Second Party will directly bring it to the First Party’s School Relationship Manager.

List of Deliverables on Yearly Basis:
Each year First Party will conduct the activities year-round, conduct minimum of 3 quizzes, 3 Examinations or assessments, one competition (Robotics Day) in a Year.
First Party will also Provide Second Party with a 1-2-minute Promotional video of the activities which can serve as a branding support to the school.

Such information should not be shared to any third party whatsoever and both the parties should try to protect the information.
